348.article_body: Amritsar Police Commissioner Arun Pal Singh on Sunday said that a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the murder of Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader Sudhir Suri. "SIT will not spare anyone and we will unravel the conspiracy," Singh said. Notably, Police had arrested the accused and said that he was "self-radicalised" and committed a hate crime.

349.title: ICAO to begin audit of India's aviation sector from November 9
349.article_body: The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO), a specialised agency of the United Nations, will start its comprehensive audit of India's aviation sector from November 9, official sources told PTI. The sources said the audit will continue till November 15. The audit starting next week will be the first ICAO audit of the Indian aviation sector post the coronavirus pandemic.

350.title: With Bavuma in side, South Africa were a batter short: Ex-Bangladesh skipper
350.article_body: Former Bangladesh skipper Habibul Bashar said that with Temba Bavuma in the side, South Africa were a batter short in their games at T20 World Cup. "Except for Nortje, every South African bowler went for runs...But the South African batters were always behind the game [against the Netherlands]," Bashar said. Notably, Bavuma scored 70 runs in five T20 WC games.

351.title: Andheri bypoll result shows people rejected BJP politics: Congress
351.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole said the Andheri (East) bypoll result showed that people have rejected the BJP's "politics of horse-trading and terrorising political opponents". Shiv Sena (Uddhav Thackeray) candidate Rutuja Latke won the bypoll with more than 66,000 votes. The BJP had withdrawn its candidate from the polls stating respect for the demise of former MLA Ramesh Latke.

352.title: Apple to change iconic 'Hey Siri' trigger phrase to just 'Siri': Report
352.article_body: Apple is working to change its iconic 'Hey Siri' trigger command used to activate its voice assistant on Apple devices to just 'Siri', Bloomberg reported. Apple has been working on this for several months and plans to roll out the change either next year or the year after. Apple is said to be testing the change among its employees.

353.title: SA won't mind their chokers tag after losing to Netherlands: Bashar
353.article_body: After South Africa crashed out of the T20 World Cup, ex-Bangladesh skipper Habibul Bashar said that Proteas currently won't mind their chokers tag, especially after losing to the Netherlands on Sunday. "It has been established now whenever they play at the bigger tournaments like WCs, they always fail...South Africa started the tournament well...they should've won this game," Bashar said.

354.title: Man arrested with barking deer meat at national park in Odisha
354.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested after he was allegedly found possessing 2.25 kg meat of barking deer at Similipal National Park in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district, as per forest officials. The accused, Sridhar Pingua, was apprehended by a forest patrol team, officials said on Sunday. Arrows and a bow were also seized from him, Assistant Conservator of Forest Jadumani Kerketa said.

355.title: 21 children abducted by gunmen from Nigerian farm released
355.article_body: As many as 21 children who were abducted by gunmen last week from a farm in Nigerian's Katsina state were released from captivity and reunited with their families on Saturday, police said. Three of the captives' parents told Reuters that the children were freed following the payment of $3,400 as ransom. However, police denied that a ransom had been paid.

356.title: 19 confirmed killed after passenger plane crashes into lake in Tanzania
356.article_body: Tanzanian PM Kassim Majaliwa said 19 people were killed while 26 others were rescued after a Precision Air flight crashed into a lake on Sunday. Flight PW 494, which was going from the Tanzanian capital Dar es Salaam to Bukoba, fell into the lake due to a storm and heavy rains just as it was about to land.

357.title: Received a DM from Virat Kohli, was surprised: MTV Hustle 2.0's MC Square
357.article_body: MTV Hustle 2.0's MC Square has revealed that he received a DM from Virat Kohli on Instagram. "I was quite surprised," he said, adding that the cricketer also follows him on Instagram. "My friends and family are the ones who told me about it. This was the moment that I realised that I have achieved something big," said MC Square.

358.title: They're absolutely fine: Neetu shares update on Alia and her baby's health
358.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor interacted with some photographers while leaving Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital where Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor welcomed a baby girl on Sunday. When asked about Alia and the baby's health, Neetu said, "They are first class. They are absolutely fine." Alia and Ranbir had announced the arrival of their daughter through a social media post.

359.title: Central govt trying to destroy higher education in Kerala: CPI(M)
359.article_body: The Kerala CPI(M) claimed that the central government is trying to prevent the implementation of welfare schemes and destroy higher education in the state. "The BJP is using the Governor to destroy higher education...when the state government was taking steps to...raise it to global standards," said CPI(M) state secretary MV Govindan. He added that the BJP 'wants to control everything'.

360.title: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav inaugurates India Pavilion at COP27
360.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Sunday inaugurated India Pavilion at 27th Session of Conference of Parties of the UNFCCC (COP27). "I'm confident that...India Pavilion will continue to remind delegates that simple lifestyle...that [is] sustainable in nature can help protect Mother Earth," Yadav said. "[India looks] forward to the introduction of new technologies," he added.

361.title: Those wanting to be close to Rahul have hijacked 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': BJP
361.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Sunday said Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' "isn't of the public or Congress party workers" and that it has been "hijacked" by leaders wanting to be close to Rahul Gandhi. The Yatra will enter Maharashtra's Nanded on November 7. "[Ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray] has missed the bus," Bawankule said regarding Thackeray's upcoming state-wide tour.

362.title: PM Modi attends mass wedding event, blesses couples in Gujarat
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday attended a mass wedding event, 'Papa ni pari', at Bhavnagar in Gujarat and blessed couples. As many as 551 girls whose fathers had passed away tied the knot at the event held by a foundation at Jawahar Maidan. PM Modi urged the newly-weds not to organise a separate wedding function afterwards.

363.title: I will think about it: Bavuma on his captaincy after SA exit from T20 WC
363.article_body: South African skipper Temba Bavuma has spoken about reconsidering his position as a captain in the team after Proteas crashed out of the T20 World Cup on Sunday. "It's been a tricky time. To be considering that now, a lot of it will be emotional, in terms of my role as captain...I will speak to the relevant people," Bavuma said.

364.title: Ducati's Francesco Bagnaia claims MotoGP title in season's final race
364.article_body: Ducati's Francesco Bagnaia claimed the MotoGP world championship in the season-ending Valencia Grand Prix on Sunday. "World champion - it sounds good...That was the hardest race of my life...I started to struggle after a few laps, but the most important thing is we are world champions," said Bagnaia. By midseason, Bagnaia was trailing outgoing champion, Fabio Quartararo, by 91 points.

365.title: Got offers from Bollywood after the success of 'Kantara': Rishab
365.article_body: Director-actor Rishab Shetty has revealed that he got offers from the Hindi film industry after the success of 'Kantara'. "But right now I want to make films in Kannada only," he added. Speaking about Bollywood actors, Rishab said he really likes Amitabh Bachchan, Shahid Kapoor and Salman Khan. 'Kantara' has reportedly collected over ₹300 crore worldwide.

366.title: RJD made dent in BJP's vote bank: Tejashwi on party's Gopalganj defeat
366.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday said that the RJD had made a dent in the BJP's core vote bank despite its defeat in the Gopalganj by-polls. "In Gopalganj, where we used to lose by a margin of 40,000 votes in 2020, we lost only by 1,794 votes this time, despite them (BJP) having a sympathy factor," Yadav said.

367.title: Efforts being made to save those behind Morbi tragedy: Kejriwal
367.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal alleged that efforts are being made to save the people responsible for the repair work of the Morbi suspension bridge. He added that if AAP forms a government in Gujarat, it will construct a grand Morbi bridge. Kejriwal said incidents like the Morbi bridge collapse will continue to occur if the BJP is voted to power.

368.title: Youth celebrates his birthday on road, police make him clean it in UP; video viral
368.article_body: Police in UP's Lucknow made a youth clean up a road after he and his friends littered it with his birthday cake while celebrating his birthday. A now-viral video has shown police instructing the youths, with one personnel saying, "This is not your house." Many Twitter users lauded the police's decision to make the boys clean the road.

369.title: Those spreading hatred will be swept out of Gujarat in polls: PM
369.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the forces that indulged in spreading hatred and defamed Gujarat will be swept out of the state in the upcoming elections. "[I'm] getting...inputs that BJP will win with a record margin this time in Gujarat," PM said. "I have come here to beat my past records," he added.

370.title: Pre-poll giveaways not best ways to help poor: Abhijit Banerjee
370.article_body: Nobel laureate and renowned economist Abhijit Banerjee said that pre-poll giveaways are not the best ways to help the poor. Stating that this needs discipline, he offered a solution and said, "Taxing the rich is a good way." He added, "A dedicated fund is a way of reducing this equality and redistribution if we have the political will."

371.title: US failed in destabilising Iran: Iranian Prez Ebrahim Raisi
371.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi on Friday said the US had failed in its attempts to replicate the Arab Spring in Iran and "destabilise" the country, Iranian media reported. This came a day before anti-hijab protests in Iran completed 50 days. On Thursday, US President Joe Biden said, "We're gonna free Iran. They (protesters) are gonna free themselves pretty soon."

372.title: Queen Elizabeth & Tom Cruise developed 'secret' friendship before her death: Report
372.article_body: UK's Queen Elizabeth had developed a 'secret' friendship with actor Tom Cruise before her death, The Sunday Times reported while quoting a source. The 96-year-old and Cruise "really hit it off" over the summer, the report said, adding that she invited him for a "special tour of Windsor Castle with everything laid on for him".

373.title: Cut-copy-paste of old promises: Cong on BJP's Himachal poll manifesto
373.article_body: After BJP released its manifesto for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, Congress termed it a "cut-copy-paste" of their 2017 promises. It said that the BJP's manifesto in parts was borrowed from the Congress' 2022 election document. In its manifesto, the BJP has promised to implement the Uniform Civil Code in the state and to open five new medical colleges.

374.title: Did PM Modi's 'kai guna' lead to the Morbi bridge tragedy: Kharge
374.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi and asked if his "kai guna" resulted in the Morbi bridge collapse that killed over 130 people. "When a similar tragedy struck West Bengal, Modi had claimed it to be God's wrath for the ills of the WB government. Who was responsible for the tragedy here?" he said.

375.title: Delhi minister to decide tomorrow on reopening primary schools, other curbs
375.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai will hold a high-level meeting on Monday to decide on reopening primary schools and revocation of the order asking 50% of government staff to work from home. Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management has lifted stage four measures under the Graded Response Action Plan. It was decided as Delhi's air quality improved to 'very poor'.

376.title: Bank officers' union alleges violation of HR norms by Standard Chartered
376.article_body: The All India Bank Officers' Confederation (AIBOC) has alleged a violation of HR practices by Standard Chartered Bank, requesting its CEO for immediate remedial measures. AIBOC also alleged that the bank is delaying in recognising the Association of Standard Chartered Bank Officers (Kolkata) (ASCBO). It added that it won't condone any attempt to thwart the fundamental rights of ASCBO members.

377.title: Virat Kohli spotted holding his chest after running double against Zimbabwe, video viral
377.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli holding his chest after running double during India's seventh over against Zimbabwe in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. In the video, Kohli can be seen taking a pause after running the quick double and holding his chest. He then took a single off the next ball.

378.title: He was tired: 'Black Panther' director recalls his last call with Chadwick
378.article_body: 'Black Panther' director Ryan Coogler, recalling his last conversation with late actor Chadwick Boseman, said, "He was tired...I could tell he was tired." "I'd been trying to get a hold of him for a few days...I could tell something was up," he added. Chadwick passed away in 2020 aged 43 while battling colon cancer.

379.title: ISRO to explore Venus, plans lunar mission with Japan
379.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is planning to venture to Venus, and is in talks with the Japanese Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) for a lunar rover to explore the moon. According to the plan, a lunar lander and rover built by ISRO will be put into orbit by a Japanese rocket. ISRO is also planning a probe to Mars.

380.title: Tourism Ministry to take part in World Travel Market from Nov 7 in London
380.article_body: India will participate in the World Travel Market from November 7-9 in London to showcase itself as a preferred destination for tourism, the government has said. "After the world's largest vaccination (COVID-19) drive, the country is ready for international tourists," the ministry said in a statement. The theme of this year's exhibition is 'The Future of Travel Starts Now'.

381.title: Karnataka signs MoUs for investments worth more than ₹9 lakh crore
381.article_body: Karnataka has signed Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) for investments worth more than ₹9 lakh crore during the three-day Global Investors Meet. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said of the total MoUs worth ₹9.8 lakh crore, projects worth ₹2.83 lakh crore have already been cleared. Over ₹2 lakh crore of the investment proposals are said to be in the green energy sector.

382.title: My weight has been 74.5 kg to 75 kg for the last 8 years: Virat Kohli
382.article_body: In a recent interview, former Team India captain Virat Kohli stated that his weight has been 74.5 kg to 75 kg for the last eight years. Kohli, in the same interview, stated that his favourite dessert is Malva Pudding. He stated, "You get it in South Africa. I tried it for first time after recommendation of Zaheer Khan in Johannesburg."

383.title: Reliance to acquire Metro Cash & Carry's India business in ₹4,060 cr deal: Report
383.article_body: Reliance Industries will acquire German wholesale retailer Metro Cash & Carry's business in India in a deal estimated at around ₹4,060 crore, PTI reported on Sunday. The deal includes 31 wholesale distribution centres, land banks and other assets owned by the company in India. Reliance didn't confirm the report, but said, "Our company evaluates various opportunities on an ongoing basis."

384.title: HC ruling on wife's right to divorce is beyond its mandate: AIMPLB
384.article_body: The AIMPLB has criticised the Kerala High Court's ruling that a Muslim woman can dissolve her nikah (marriage) without her husband's permission. AIMPLB said the Kerala HC has gone beyond its mandate in the manner it interpreted the Islamic divorce laws. The court held that the wife's right to end her marriage was in conformity with the Quran.

385.title: Cricket is a funny game: Babar after Pak advance to semifinals
385.article_body: After Pakistan advanced to the semifinals of the T20 World Cup 2022, skipper Babar Azam said that cricket is a funny game. "Appreciate all [members of] my team the way they played all matches," Babar said. On winning against Bangladesh on Sunday, Babar said, "Pitch [was]..two-paced...I and Rizwan decided to go long but unfortunately didn't work out."

386.title: Will save Gujarat from deceit of BJP's double engine: Rahul Gandhi
386.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said his party will fulfil the promises it made to Gujarat and save it from the "deceit" of the BJP's "double engine". "LPG cylinder in ₹500, 10 lakh jobs to youth, farmer's loan waiver up to ₹3 lakh," said Rahul. Elections will be held in Gujarat in two phases on December 1 and 5.

387.title: Employee fired by Twitter shares post, says 'Looks like I'm unemployed'
387.article_body: As Elon Musk-owned Twitter started firing employees, tweets from employees about getting fired from the company surfaced online. In one of the tweets, a senior community manager at Twitter, Simon Balmain, revealed that he was fired from the company. "Looks like I'm unemployed...Just got remotely logged out of my work laptop...So sad it had to end this way," he tweeted.

388.title: This is best performance we had among all T20 WCs we played: Shakib
388.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan said that in terms of results, the performance of their country in the T20 World Cup 2022 has been the best among all T20 WCs they have played in. On losing to Pakistan on Sunday, Shakib said, "Knew it was going to be difficult for the new batters so wanted set batters to carry through."

389.title: Come Nov 12, people of HP will say 'Jai Ram ji ki' to CM Thakur: Cong
389.article_body: Come November 12, the people of Himachal Pradesh will say "Jai Ram ji ki" to CM Jai Ram Thakur, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said on Sunday. "The work of the government is something people are unhappy with. There has been huge corruption, paper leaks, financial impropriety and misgovernance. Winds of change are blowing all over the state," Pilot said.

390.title: BJP-ruled MCD spent ₹35 cr in 17 yrs on under-construction hospital: Atishi
390.article_body: AAP leader Atishi said BJP-ruled Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) spent ₹35 crore since 2005 on a hospital in South Delhi which is still "under construction". "BJP promised just one multi-speciality hospital but failed to build even that," Atishi said. She further claimed that only ground and first floors of the hospital in Kalkaji were functional.

391.title: Ola Electric to touch production of 10 lakh units by November 2023: CEO
391.article_body: Ola Electric CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted that the company will touch cumulative production of 10 lakh units by November 2023. Earlier the company had said it has the current capacity of 20 lakh units per annum at its factory. "Starting next week, we will deliver to customers across India same day or within 2-3 days," Aggarwal added.

392.title: Actor Kamal Haasan, filmmaker Mani Ratnam to work together after 35 yrs
392.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan and filmmaker Mani Ratnam will be working together after 35 years. Kamal took to Twitter to make the announcement and wrote, "Here we go again!" The film is tentatively titled 'KH 234' and will be jointly produced by Kamal and Ratnam. Kamal last worked with the 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' filmmaker in the 1987 film 'Nayakan'.

393.title: I have improved, not easy to come back from injury: Shaheen Afridi
393.article_body: After being adjudged as the 'Player of the Match' against Bangladesh on Sunday, Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi said that it's not easy to come back from injury and bowl at 140 kmph. "I have improved...Bowl in the right areas and fast was the plan," Afridi said. Notably, Pakistan have advanced to the semi-finals of the ongoing T20 World Cup.

394.title: Need to play consistently against defensive Spain: Indian hockey skipper
394.article_body: Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that their side needs to play consistently across all four quarters against "defensive" Spain who have the ability to slow their opponent's game. "Playing consistently all through the four quarters was our main goal [against New Zealand]. We will need to play the same way against Spain," Harmanpreet said.

395.title: Who are the highest wicket-takers in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage?
395.article_body: Sri Lanka spinner Wanindu Hasaranga is the highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage. Hasaranga took 15 wickets in eight matches for Sri Lanka, who've been eliminated in Super 12 stage. Hasaranga is followed by Netherlands' Bas de Leede (13), Zimbabwe's Blessing Muzarabani (12). Arshdeep Singh is India's highest wicket-taker with 10 wickets so far.

396.title: Never used term affair when I spoke about Karan Mehra & Charu: Rajeev
396.article_body: Rajeev Sen has said that he never used the term "affair" when he spoke about actor Karan Mehra and his estranged wife Charu Asopa. "I only said that Charu's mother disclosed to me through her voice note that her daughter is making reels with Karan...I didn't say anything against Karan. He has misunderstood my statement," he added.

397.title: Pak spending 66% of its forex reserves on fuel imports: Report
397.article_body: Pakistan is currently spending approximately $21.43 billion, or 66% of its total foreign exchange reserves, annually on fuel imports, The Express Tribune reported. This comes amid the global surge in energy prices and a faltering Pakistani economy. Notably, the delivered price of coal imported from South Africa has increased from $177/tonne to $407/tonne over the last year, the report said.

398.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in T20 World Cup 2022 after Super 12 stage?
398.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli is the highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup 2022 so far with 246 runs in five innings. He's followed by Netherlands' Max O'Dowd, who scored 242 runs in eight innings. India's Suryakumar Yadav, who is featuring in his first-ever T20 World Cup, is third on the list with 225 runs.

399.title: Did you think you'd see a pic like this?: Bhogle on pic of Suryakumar's batting
399.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday took to Twitter to share a picture of India's Suryakumar Yadav while he was batting against Zimbabwe. Bhogle tweeted, "Did you think you would see a photograph like this?" He added, "Remember the old "spot the ball contest" days? How on earth would anyone know what's happening here and where the ball has ended up!"

400.title: Indian hackers' gang targeted critics of Qatar World Cup: UK news report
400.article_body: A gang of India-based computer hackers accessed files of journalists, politicians and critics of the FIFA World Cup 2022, scheduled to take place in Qatar in November, a British news report has claimed. The hacking was 'masterminded' by a 31-year-old accountancy firm employee based in India's Gurugram, the report claimed. Qatar has denied the allegations, calling them "patently false".
